titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Works by Arnold Wesker given to Nathaniel Tarn
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Collection of works by Arnold Wesker given to Nathaniel Tarn.,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Part of the collection has been cataloged individually by monograph title. The material in this collection is more ephemeral, including texts in magazines, criticism, theater programs, posters, and a sketch.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of works by Arnold Wesker given to Nathaniel Tarn., M1369. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: Arnold Wesker gave a collection of his works to Nathaniel Tarn, in part because Tarn was a very thorough collector, but also to see what such a collection would eventually look like and perhaps, to ascertain at some point in the future what value would be ascribed to such a collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Part of the collection has been cataloged individually by monograph title. The material in this collection is more ephemeral, including texts in magazines, criticism, theater programs, posters, and a sketch.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Part of the collection has been cataloged individually by monograph title.

scopecontent.p: "Love Letters on Blue Paper," Play text of Wesker play, Berlin. Henschalverlag, Henschal Collection. With publisher's free copy form to Wesker. Inscription to Nathaniel Tarn.
Play text of play by Wesker, Plays and Players, Vol. 24 , No. 7, London. Inscribed to Nathaniel Tarn.
Play text of play by Wesker, in Adam International Review, Vol. XLI,. 401-403, London. Also contains an article: "Wesker's Quest for Values" by Peter Bowering, and "Leah," an essay by Wesker.

did.unittitle: "A Time of Dying: A Sort of Short Story"1973

scopecontent.p: Essay by Wesker in Jewish Quarterly, Vol. 21, Nos. 1-2, London. Contains reproduction of painting of Wesker. See also Box 3, Photographs and Drawings. Note and inscription to Nathaniel Tarn.
Essay by Wesker in Observer Sunday Magazine, with a painting of East End street by John Allin.

did.unittitle: Arnold Wesker as a character in a comic book.1974

scopecontent.p: New Times, Class War Comics, No. 1, Brighton U. K. Also contains a drawing of Wesker taken from The London Times Colour Supplement, talks about Wesker's play "The Friends," produced in 1970. Explanatory note and inscription to Nathaniel Tarn.
Lecture by Wesker given at Le Confereze dell' Associazione Culturale Italiana, in Genoa Turin, Milan, Rome. Published in Fasciolo 42. Inscribed to Nathaniel Tarn.
Essay by Wesker on his mother., in Femina, Helsingberg, Sweden. Early family photos reproduced. Inscription to Nathaniel Tarn.
Journal entries by Wesker for his play "The Journalists," in Theatre Quarterly, London, Vol. VII, No. 26.
Interview with Wesker in The Nation, Vol. 225, No. 18. Inscribed to Nathaniel Tarn.
Essay by Wesker in The School Times, Vol I, No. 2 , London. Autographed by Wesker to his grandson, Jonathan Bickerbike.
Essay by Wesker in The Writer's News, London. Inscribed to Nathaniel Tarn.
